revised_title: Anatomy of the Central Nervous System in Plagiostomata
tldr: The author examines the anatomy of the central nervous system in various species of Plagiostomata, focusing on the brain, optic lobe, and spinal cord. They describe the structure and function of different parts of the brain, including the cerebrum, olfactory lobe, and cerebellum, as well as the spinal cord's structure and the distribution of cranial nerves.
